qas.question: What living thing did Bell use in his research?
What phrase did people believe Bell's dog could say?
What did Bell  instruct his dog to do?

context: Intrigued by the results of the automaton, Bell continued to experiment with a live subject, the family's <a0_0>Skye Terrier<a0_0/>, "<a1_0>Trouve<a1_0/>". After he taught it to <a4_0>growl continuously<a4_0/>, Bell would reach into its mouth and manipulate the dog's lips and vocal cords to produce a crude-sounding "Ow ah oo ga ma ma". With little convincing, visitors believed his dog could articulate "<a2_0>How are you grandma?<a2_0/>" More indicative of his playful nature, his experiments convinced onlookers that they saw a "talking dog". However, these initial forays into experimentation with sound led Bell to undertake his first serious work on the transmission of sound, using <a3_0>tuning forks<a3_0/> to explore resonance.
